issue.title: Automatically generate API overview documentation
issue.body:
This PR should address #50922. It basically:

- ~~Generate \since tags from doxgen and git (it may not be perfect, but it's a fairly comprehensive start);~~
- Manually ~~fix~~ add some based on current information from doc/develop/api.overview.rst;
- Add \version (showing stability level) based on information from doc/develop/api.overview.rst;
- Use all new info (\since and \version) to generate the new API overview page, which is basically an improved version of doxygen own "Modules index" page.

More details of each step are on the commit messages. Two things that still stand out:
 - To parse the doxygen XML info, I've used its own "doxmlparser" Python lib, but it needs to be installed from the sources, as there's no package on PyPi. There's an open issue at doxygen repo about it: https://github.com/doxygen/doxygen/issues/8848
 - The new API overview page points to the doxygen documentation, not for any RST that may exist for it. Since the page now comes from doxygen, we could a) add a new `xrefitem` tag to reference it, but then we'd have doxygen pointing to RST and RST pointing to doxygen, which could be an issue; or b) have another file to map RST pages for some doxygen groups, but it would be another burden to maintain. Any thoughts about this?

Fixes #50922

comment.body: we can also look into using `pip install -i https://test.pypi.org/simple/ doxmlparser` until there is an official release to help with getting populating the versioning information and having something useful by the next release. We do not need updated doxygen version itself, just this python package anyways.

issue.title: tests: Fix spinlock test
issue.body:
Spinlock tests are reusing some parts of the code in several test paths, making it unreadable and depending on the result of the previous executing (using too much globals).

Clear globals and adding delays for fast CPUs.

Fixes #60330

comment.body:
> Just for my own understanding, this is effectively micro-scheduling - conditioning the scheduler into making it easier for a different thread to acquire the lock.
> 

Yes, this is, probably, correct description, could not find a better way to pass the test.

pull_request.title: Add support for STM32 ADC power management
pull_request.body:
This PR adds support for the power management of the STM32 ADC.
It also adds a sample to test power consumption.
Without PM, the measured consumption is 475µA, with PM, about 25µA

issue.title: drivers: pinctrl: sam: Add wake-up source support

labels.name: area: Devicetree Binding
labels.description: PR modifies or adds a Device Tree binding

issue.body:
This add the pin wake-up source configuration capabilities to the SAM pinctrl driver. It add the SUPC functions at SoC and update gpio and pinctrl drivers to allow user configure the wake-up core power supply functionality.

depends on #63961

comment.body:
Hi @gmarull ,

I was wondering if it is possible establish a direction that the _wake-up by GPIO_ should be used by the `compatible = "gpio-keys";` as the missing standard you mentioned. I would be happy to rework the example here to be generic in another PR.

As should be already clear, I've been using what is already well defined by Linux. The current proposal only update the `pinctrl` API which should be consumed, I hope, in near future by the `gpio-keys` driver.

As reference, the below is from the Linux master branch:

https://github.com/torvalds/linux/blob/750b95887e567848ac2c851dae47922cac6db946/arch/arm/boot/dts/microchip/at91-sama5d2_xplained.dts#L708-L720

In this case, since the `gpio-keys` is a well defined way to provide this functionality in Linux and, it can uses `pinctrl`, this tells me that this model could be a good candidate to establish a _de facto_ standard for the wake-up use case. If it is the case, I would like know if the PR can be moved forward without the sample and `gpio-keys` at this moment. Once this is in in tree, I can start to work to add the `pinctrl` details for the `gpio-keys` driver. This will keep things simpler instead blow a PR with such many things.

I hope I made my intentions clear so we can move forward and be closer to a possible standard for the wake-up feature in Zephyr.

pull_request.title: twister: pytest: Parametrize scope of the dut fixture
pull_request.body:
Added `pytest_dut_scope` keyword under `harness_config` section. New keyword is used to determine the scope of `dut` and `shell` fixtures in `pytest-twister-harness` plugin.

Feature request: https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/issues/58288#issuecomment-1768517666

To test it you can add:
```
harness_config:
  pytest_dut_scope: module
```
to `samples/subsys/testsuite/pytest/shell/testcase.yaml`
and run `./scripts/twister -vv -T samples/subsys/testsuite/pytest/shell -p qemu_x86`
or try it with hw device:
`./scripts/twister -vv -T samples/subsys/testsuite/pytest/shell --west-flash --device-testing --hardware-map hardware_map.yml`
than you can find, that the device is flashed only once.

Note: header of test is logged to `handler.log` (and `device.log` for HW) only once per fixture scope, so for `session` scope you miss the headers with test name and time in those logfiles at the beginning of the testcases (but they are still in `twister.log`).

pull_request.title: Bluetooth: Controller: Fix corruption during BIG_CHANNEL_MAP_IND
pull_request.body:
radio_pkt_big_ctrl_get() returns a statically allocated buffer of type pdu_big_ctrl, but the callers expect a full pdu_bis, and use it as such, overflowing the statically allocated buffer, and smashing other variables after.

Let's fix it by allocating a buffer of size pdu_bis.

Fixes https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/issues/64497

labels.description: At least 4 hours in review before merge

issue.title: scripts: check_init_priorities: usability updates
issue.body:
Since bb590b5b6e introduced ordinals in the priority sequence, the "same priority" case cannot happen anymore, furthermore the priority value in the script is now the position of the function in the init sequence, so if two devices have the same priority there's something real bad going on.

Drop all the "same priority" handling code and tests, convert the case into ane exception instead. Drop the init stubs as well from the test, they are not required anymore.

---

The current error messages are a bit cryptic, rework them to make them more meaningful:

- add an extra message on the first error to explain what the errors refer to.
- rework the error message to be more explicit.
- rework the priority string print to use a LEVEL+offset format to somehow highlight that the number is the offset from the level, not the actual priority.
- print the init function name in addition to the devicetree path.

Fixes https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/issues/64386

comment.body:
@kartben took a stab at improving the messages to make this more understandable, unfortunately I'm quite limited in the information I have from the final linker executable and trying to dig more is a bit of a compiler compatibility nightmare, but I think it looks a lot better now, this an example of the new messages:


```
ERROR: Device initialization priority validation failed, the sequence of initialization calls does not match the devicetree dependencies.
ERROR: /pwmleds <led_pwm_init> is initialized before its dependency /soc/pwm@4001c000 <pwm_nrfx_init0> (PRE_KERNEL_1+7 < POST_KERNEL+4)
```

What do you think?

issue.title: doc: Fix typos
issue.body:
Fix typos in the documentation.

Signed-off-by: Stefan Haubenthal <polluks@sdf.lonestar.org>

comment.body:
> Please squash the commits together, fix the commit message as described before and force push the changes.

I'm not fit in rebasing...

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -33,6 +33,12 @@ Requirements
 Building and Running
 ********************
 
+First, ensure the optional LVGL module is enabled and available:
+
+   .. code-block:: console
+      west config manifest.group-filter +optional
comment.body:
Narrow down to a project filter (ref https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/west/issues/696)

```suggestion
      west config manifest.project-filter -- +lvgl
```

pull_request.title: Bluetooth: Controller: Fix corruption during BIG_CHANNEL_MAP_IND
pull_request.body:
radio_pkt_big_ctrl_get() returns a statically allocated buffer of type pdu_big_ctrl, but the callers expect a full pdu_bis, and use it as such, overflowing the statically allocated buffer, and smashing other variables after.

Let's fix it by allocating a buffer of size pud_bis.

Fixes https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/issues/64497

pull_request.title: drivers: plic: make trigger type default & define registers directly in driver
pull_request.body:
Removes the trigger type Kconfig option & hardcodes all the registers' offset in the driver instead of getting them from the devicetree since they are strictly defined in the RISCV PLIC specs and aren't something configurable.

See the following for more info:
- https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/pull/62907#discussion_r1332817434
- [RISCV PLIC: Memory Map](https://github.com/riscv/riscv-plic-spec/blob/master/riscv-plic.adoc#2-memory-map)

> [!NOTE]  
> This PR is spined off from https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/pull/62907

Fixes #63466

issue.title: ci: twister: store the list of python packages
issue.body:
This adds the Python package list used by the CI image to the list of uploaded artifacts as part of the push runs so it can be stored as part of the release, see the discussion in https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr/issues/64281.

Ideally this would be fully automated, so a followup would be to add a workflow that runs on tag events that gets the list and uploads it as a PR for the release target branch.

Note that this has to run on one of the workflows using the same CI image as twister (i.e. can't run it in `release.yml`, at least in the current setup).

~~Test run: https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr-testing/actions/runs/6643831683 outdated~~

---

Add a step to the #1 twister shard to upload the list of Python packages used with the build.

comment.body:
- switched the step to use `bash`, new run: https://github.com/zephyrproject-rtos/zephyr-testing/actions/runs/6665552405

```console
$ head -n10 frozen-requirements.txt 
# Generated at Fri Oct 27 10:21:02 AM UTC 2023 (v2.2.0-rc1-48482-g997307cd8d42)

anytree==2.9.0
appdirs==1.4.4
arrow==1.2.3
astroid==2.15.6
Babel==2.8.0
blinker==1.4
```
